-- "Roger Smith" <rog_21@...> wrote...


>Darren,
>do you have any documentation on shaperecog?

Only the post I made some time ago which explained the inputs, outputs, and
the nets' environment.

>I am extremely new to neat and am just trying to
>understand it now.

Well, in the source, you'll want to look at dazchar_evaluate() where the
evaluation routine lives. I'm afraid it isn't commented well, but it was
just meant as a test to satisfy my own curiosity.

>do you think I could take a look at your
>source code and maybe extend it to signature
>recognition?

You could try: all you'd need to do would be change gridcirc[],
griddiamond[] and gridsquare[] to contain your signatures, and modify the
coordinate limits for the new image sizes... Of course, in the real world
you'd want to load them from bitmaps, which wouldn't necessarily be hard,
it'd just need a bit more work.

Of course, the shapes I chose are reasonably simple. I can't say how well
NEAT would handle more complex shapes.

--Darren
